title: Local Politics Dominate Midterm Elections
teaser: The midterm elections this year will determine whether the U.S. Senate switches parties, but national issues aren't going to be driving voters to the polls.
contentencoded:
The midterm elections this year will determine whether the U.S. Senate stays Democratic or turns Republican.

But as pollsters Anna Greenberg and Kristen Soltis Anderson tell Here & Now’s Robin Young, there are no nationally important issues driving voters’ decisions.

Instead, the midterms are being waged on a smaller scale, with many local issues spurring individual races.

  • Related: Rachel Rohr’s Alternate Routes
  • Related: Here & Now’s Senate Tracker series
  • Related: Here & Now’s District Profile series

Guests

  • Anna Greenberg, senior vice president of Greenberg Quinlan Rosner Research. She tweets @Anna_Greenberg.
  • Kristen Soltis Anderson, partner and co-founder of Echelon Insights. She tweets @KSoltisAnderson.
